image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: US arrests drug godfather 'El Mayo': What’s next for Sinaloa cartel?
item.description: Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada’s arrest by US authorities signals a turbulent shift for Mexico's Sinaloa cartel. Experts anticipate increased violence as factions vie for power, while Zambada might reveal critical cartel operations. Mexican forces have bolstered security in response, and US officials stress the arrest's impact on drug trafficking. Strategic implications loom as cooperation potential arises.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'The worst choice of all': Why some Republicans are questioning Trump's choice of JD Vance as Vice President
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: American support for female president falls: Report
item.description: A new Times/SAY24 poll by YouGov reveals a decline in American support for a female president, dropping nine points since 2015. The survey, conducted after President Biden exited the race, shows 54% of voters are ready for a woman president. Persistent gender bias remains, with 41% believing many wouldn't support an equally qualified woman over a man.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'She was a bum': Trump attacks Harris, complains about Biden's exit in first appearance without ear bandage
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Sunita Williams passes the torch as Nasa astronauts hold Summer Olympics in space
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Who is Ronnie Stout? Ex-con arrested for starting California's largest wildfire
item.description: Ronnie Dean Stout II, a 42-year-old former convict, has been arrested for starting the Park Fire in California, now burning over 164,000 acres. Allegedly, Stout pushed a burning car into a gully at Bidwell Park, igniting the massive blaze. The fire, only 3% contained, led to widespread evacuations. Stout faces arson charges and potential life imprisonment under California's "Three Strikes" law.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hidden ocean in Uranus' moon Ariel? Nasa's James telescope close to a new discovery
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Watch: Plane crashes in yard of Utah home with family inside
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: FBI clears confusion: Bullet, not Shrapnel, struck Trump in July attack
item.description: The FBI confirmed that former President Donald Trump was struck by a bullet, not shrapnel or glass, during the July 13 assassination attempt at a Pennsylvania rally. This clarification follows weeks of conflicting reports and speculation. Trump and his allies, frustrated by earlier ambiguity, have sharply criticised the FBI and its Director, Christopher Wray.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How US tricked and captured infamous Mexican drug lord 'El Mayo'
item.description: Ismael ‘El Mayo’ Zambada, co-founder of the Sinaloa Cartel, and his ally Joaquín Guzmán López were arrested in El Paso, Texas, in a dramatic capture involving deception. Zambada, a key cartel figure, faces multiple drug-related charges. His arrest marks a significant blow to organised crime and may lead to internal conflicts within the cartel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I’ve got nothing against cats': How JD Vance defended 'childless cat ladies' remark amid backlash; Watch video
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ismael 'El Mayo' Zambada, alleged Mexican kingpin, pleads not guilty to US charges
item.description: Ismael Zambada, the alleged co-founder of the Sinaloa Cartel, pleaded not guilty to US drug charges. He was arrested in Texas alongside Joaquin Guzman Lopez son of Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman. Their arrest may impact Mexico's criminal landscape significantly. Zambada, known for his old-school tactics, contrasts with Guzman Lopez's flashier approach.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump vows to return to site of assassination attempt for 'big and beautiful' rally
item.description: Former US President Trump announced a rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, where he survived an assassination attempt. Vice President Kamala Harris, endorsed by Barack Obama, concluded her campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination. Polls show Trump leading Harris by a narrow margin. The Obamas' endorsement could boost Harris' support and fundraising, potentially influencing her White House bid.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Passengers exact 'revenge' on Delta Airlines following flight delays - Did they go too far?
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris files nomination for US presidential elections
item.description: Kamala Harris has officially announced her candidacy for the US presidential elections, following Joe Biden's withdrawal and endorsement. Barack Obama also endorsed her, describing her as a fantastic leader. Harris aims to secure votes through a people-powered campaign. In a post on X, the US vice president said, "Today, I signed the forms officially declaring my candidacy for President of the United States." The elections are set for November 5 and will see Harris competing against Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China warns Philippines of 'resolute' response in South China Sea
item.description: China will "respond resolutely" to any violation by the Philippines of a recent deal to calm tensions between the two countries in the South China Sea, its top diplomat told his Filipino counterpart, Beijing said Saturday. "Otherwise, China will definitely respond resolutely," he said.

item.title: US fire: Massive evacuation ordered as vegetation fire burns 150 acres between Bay Point and Concord
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: Donald Trump leads Kamala Harris by narrow margin in latest poll
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump meets Netanyahu, attacks Harris over Gaza issue: Key takeaways from Mar-a-Lago meeting
item.description: Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu met at Mar-a-Lago to restore their relationship after three years. Trump's support for Israel was reiterated amidst the Gaza conflict. Netanyahu discussed a possible ceasefire and US relations. Both leaders aimed to present strong leadership and diplomatic prowess.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinese man loses eye after swatting fly on face
item.description: In Shenzhen, a man's severe eye infection from a drain fly led to his eyeball's removal after initial medication failed. Experts stress cleaning kitchens and bathrooms to prevent such infections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
